availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Dillon Campbell (Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. )

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of James Campbell and Mary Campbell. Stepson of Thomas N. Dodson, Sr. Married to Margaret Ursula Gray Campbell. Father of James N. Campbell, Mary C. Campbell, Frank Campbell, Capitola Campbell, William L. Campbell, and Leona Campbell. Farmer in Ballard County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Ballard County in 1850. Farmer in Ballard County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Ballard County in 1860. Employed John Harris and Leonard Smith as farmhands in Ballard County in 1860.
